s.text: "I just wanted to throw strikes and make them hit the ball," he told the man from the Times .
But another reason, I think, is that baby boomers in particular have tended to segregate themselves along political lines as well as class and racial lines.
I've lived, for instance, in Austin, Texas, Boston, and Washington, D.C., as well as Northampton.
There may well be large pockets of gay hatred in the land, but it's not something I can gauge because I rarely see it in my daily life.
"I just wanted to throw strikes and make them hit the ball," he told the man from the Times .

It makes sense only in the context of Republican presidential politics--that is, such extreme positions can rally the hard-core faithful who vote in primaries, and thus help a candidate gain the nomination, but will only be a curse once the general election rolls around.
